In Latin means ‚ÄúOut of Many One‚Äù. A scene inspired by Roman mythology is in the outer circle of this painting. The woman directly underneath Washington is Lady Freedom. She is in the outer circle dressed in armor to symbolize the continuous fight for freedom. Thanks for joining.

George Washington is depicted in the center circle of the painting, and Lady Liberty and Lady Victory are on either side of him. They are surrounded by thirteen maidens, who represent the thirteen original colonies. They are holding a banner that says ‚ÄúE Pluribus Unum.‚Äù

The ‚ÄúApotheosis of Washington‚Äù inside the Capitol rotunda was painted by Constantino Brumidi in 1865 and took 11 months to complete. This work of art is 180 feet above the rotunda floor and almost 5,000 square feet ‚Äì large enough to fit a NBA basketball court! #CapitolHistory http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DjzFLfnVsAAb11B.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DjzFLfmUcAELXze.jpg
